releaseGoal: Distributed order processing and fulfillment system

context.description: Building distributed microservices for order processing, inventory management, and fulfillment
businessGoals: Scale order processing to 10x current volume

technicalContext.stack: Spring Boot microservices, Kafka for events, Kubernetes for orchestration
technicalContext.teamExperience: Experienced team with distributed systems knowledge

expectedOutcomes.practiceAdherence: High, team experienced with agile practices

specialConsiderations: Service boundaries and contracts must be clear
Pair programming helps with complex distributed debugging
System metaphor critical for shared understanding of architecture
May need to split team into sub-teams per service
Continuous integration must handle multiple services
microservicesSpecificPractices: Service-level pair programming with rotation across services
Shared understanding through architecture decision records

teamStructure.suggestion: Consider 2 sub-teams of 4, each owning 2-3 services
teamStructure.coordination: Daily sync between sub-teams, shared retrospectives
teamStructure.pairing: Rotate pairs across sub-teams for knowledge sharing
teamStructure.collectiveOwnership: Critical - anyone should be able to work on any service
